@ pobban2:

They are popular because they have a request system and many many releases. There is almost no movie that I have searched and they hadn't already released it or in queue to be released. They have released many good old movies too.

But I believe that the main reason they are so popular is because they try to achieve the best combination of small file size and good quality, something that (I believe) matters to the majority of the p2p community.

P.S. The problem is not the time needed to download a big torrent but uploading it with at least 1:1 ratio with a 512kbps/1mbps/2mbps upload speed and especially when having to upload like 5 movies, 5 episodes, 2 games, etc.

Hi dhowan, I feel your pain cause I also hate that cinavia message on my ps3 and stuff, but I have found a way around it, during the movie when it pops up,, just simply hit the ps button, and go to settings and then time and date and just change the year by 1 year and then go back to the movie:D you might of missed like 3 seconds of the movie but its worth it, and the cinavia message will pop up every 20 mins, so simply just re do the process, it sounds long and hard but its really easy, please everyone spread the word so that we can watch more:P

hi dohwan, okay so while u in the movie and cinavia pops up , press the ps button, and go to date and time setting on ur ps3, and then change the date by +1 year and go back to watching ur movie:D its sounds long and hard but its really easy and u only miss a few seconds, the ciavia message pops up every 20mins so just repeat the process:D hope u enjoy ur movie

For those who are to stupid to understand why this is in HD, this is a 21:9 aspect ratio, not a 16:9. This means that it cannot be 1280p:720p because it would warp the screen. the 720p represents Height, not quality. The quality you get from 720p is because of the large resolution, while this may be 536p, it still contains the 720p quality. Only difference is the 21:9 vs 16:9 (This has black bars). to "Increase" the resolution would be a waste of time and unnecessary file size increase.

@3ntomb3d,

YIFY does a amazing job at keeping video quality, but it is fairly debatable that it would not hurt the file size at all to give it 5.1. I like to think YIFY keeps it 2 channels for its large widespread capability. There are many devices that do not cooperate very well with 5.1 and would not be deemed necessary for devices that don't even support 5.1. 2 channel still provides a decent quality. I REALLY don't think it would kill to use 128 audio though. Its a slight increase from the 95 and would help prevent me from having to turn my headset ALL the way up.
